            & DELIVERY PROJECT,TF029400-PHRD - HEALTH CARE FINANCING
            AND DELIVERY PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Government of Jordan is taking
            actions for a long-term reform program in the health sector.
            Placed within the strategic context, the program will
            contribute to the achievement of macroeconomic stability and
            growth. The Health Sector Reform Project supports the first
            phase of the reform program, and its main objectives are to
            contain growth in health expenditures, improve health care
            services, and assure efficiency in the use of physical
            facilities. The project components include: 1) The
            rationalization of the investment strategy for health
            delivery systems, which will directly support economic
            efficiency improvement. A health facility masterplan will
            incorporate norms and standards, overall needs, and public
            and private sector capacity. 2) The development of health
            information systems, which will provide relevant and timely
            epidemiological data and improve management information
            systems for patients record keeping, services, inventory,
            and personnel. 3) The improvement of private hospital
            financing will establish accounting standards and adjust
            budgetary allocations efficiently. 4) The reform of the
            pharmaceutical sector will promote generic substitution,
            rationalize the use of drugs, and reform drug procurement.
            5) A continuing reform process will be addressed, and
            special studies conducted. Technical expertise recruits will
            aim at exploring alternative reform proposals.
